Indications and doses

Prophylaxis of asthma,

By inhalation of powder

  • For adults
    Initially 400 micrograms daily in 1–2 divided doses, single dose to be inhaled in the evening, reduced to 200 micrograms once daily, if control maintained.
  • For children 12–17 years
    Initially 400 micrograms daily in 1–2 divided doses, single dose to be inhaled in the evening, reduced to 200 micrograms once daily, if control maintained.

Prophylaxis of severe asthma,

By inhalation of powder

  • For adults
    Increased if necessary up to 400 micrograms twice daily.
  • For children 12–17 years
    Increased if necessary up to 400 micrograms twice daily.

Severe inflammatory skin disorders such as eczemas unresponsive to less potent corticosteroids, Psoriasis,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply once daily, to be applied thinly (to scalp in case of lotion).
  • For children 2–17 years
    Apply once daily, to be applied thinly (to scalp in case of lotion).

Prophylaxis and treatment of allergic rhinitis,

By intranasal administration

  • For adults
    100 micrograms daily, increased if necessary up to 200 micrograms daily, dose to be sprayed into each nostril; reduced to 50 micrograms daily, dose to be reduced when control achieved, dose to be sprayed into each nostril.
  • For children 6–11 years
    50 micrograms daily, dose to be sprayed into each nostril.
  • For children 12–17 years
    100 micrograms daily, increased if necessary up to 200 micrograms daily, dose to be sprayed into each nostril; reduced to 50 micrograms daily, dose to be reduced when control achieved, dose to be sprayed into each nostril.

Nasal polyps,

By intranasal administration

  • For adults
    Initially 100 micrograms daily for 5–6 weeks, dose to be sprayed into each nostril, then increased if necessary to 100 micrograms twice daily, dose to be sprayed into each nostril, consider alternative treatment if no improvement after further 5–6 weeks, reduce to the lowest effective dose when control achieved.

Potency of preperations

Mometasone furoate 0.1% cream, ointment, and scalp lotion: potent.

Known side effects

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: headache,

uncommon: dyspepsia, palpitation, weight gain,

Nasal ulceration

Nasal ulceration occurs commonly with preparations containing mometasone furoate.

Advice for patients and carers

With topical use

Patients and carers should be advised on the application of topical mometasone.

In children

Medicines for Children leaflet: Mometasone furoate inhaler for asthma prevention (prophylaxis)

www.medicinesforchildren.org.uk/mometasone-furoate-inhaler-for-asthma-prevention-prophylaxis

When used by inhalation

Patients or carers should be given advice on how to administer mometasone by inhaler. With high doses, a steroid card should be supplied.

National funding/access decisions

Unlicensed use

With topical use in children

Not licensed for use in children under 2 years.
